body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
OFFICE SECRETARY OF STATE,
Frankfort,
Dear Sir Governor

I know all about this case and think it presents strong claims for Executive Clemency Mr Hart is quite a poor young man, tho' as clever as any can be and of as good family as there is in the state being a relation of Mrs Magoffin Blacks brother married Harts sister & it was in that way he was induced to go security -- Blacks offences being only misdemeanors, & punishable by fines -- being for selling whisky to slaves -- He has left the state for the States good, & if he should return he can be taken up & tried, the judgments indictments standing against him still -- No good can be done by making Mr Hart pay the fine, & hope you will release him of as much of the fine as you
